newsitem.title: FRANCE: Danzas sees own China operation by mid-97.
newsitem.headline: Danzas sees own China operation by mid-97.

text.p: Swiss freighter forwarder, Danzas AG, said on Tuesday it hoped to have its own operation in China by the middle of the year.

"We have plans to set up our own structure in China paving the way for full subsidiary status and are banking on taking a significant step towards this next month," Danzas' Intercontinental division director, Renato Chiavi, told Reuters in a telephone interview from Basle.
The Intercontinental division groups ocean and air freight activities.

"We currently have agreements with several Chinese agents for ocean and air freight and have 45 staff based there working out of a network of seven offices, including Beijing and Shangai. However, having an operator's licence would give us greater control over the full service package from sales and to logistics," Chiavi said.

He said there was a good niche market for airfreight exports to China of capital goods from Europe for joint-venture projects in the People's Republic, especially during the initial development stages.
And the opening up of the Chinese economy in general would provide longer term opportunities, he added.
Danzas has already reported 20 percent sales growth in the Far East in 1996 with Hong Kong and Singapore as two key expanding markets.
The group's 1996 global airfreight volume totalled 357,000 tonnes compared to 306,000 tonnes in 1995. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+5017
